intro: Otostegia fruticosa subsp. schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian coffee tree, is a small evergreen shrub native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates and is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils. This subspecies is of particular interest for its potential in horticulture and conservation due to its unique ecological niche.
